data.name: Calculate the Area under the polynomial curve!
data.description:
# Abstract: Imagine you were trying to do a mobile aplication that could solve definite integrals of polynomials! The user would have to take a photo of a definite integral and the result would be given in his screen. This aplication could be decomposed in 2 tasks.
  1. Finding the valuable information in the photo (integration limits and function )
  2. Given a string with the function and the integration limits calculate the result
This Kata focuses on the second. # Description: You will be given a string with a polynomial function such as ``` x^4 + 2x^2 + 1``` and in order to complete this kata your are supposed to determine the definite integral from a to b of this function and return it. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integral) the prototype of this function will be .. ``` float Integrate_me(char variable, float a, float b, char* polynomial )``` # Example: ``` Integrate_me('y', 0, 1," y^7 + 2y^4 + 1 -y^7 ")``` should return 1.400000 # Note :

Don't forget coeficients can be negative.

x to the power of n will come represented as x^n (no spaces).

If the polynomial is ```-x^k + x^k ```.It's definite integral from any a to any b will be 0.

You might come up with a different solution to this problem that i didn't originaly expect. If you are able to do so ignore the following tips. # Tips: Take as granted the following propositions. + Diferentiation can be seen as a Linear transformation, and as a consequence of that it can be represented as a matrix.(http://mathworld.wolfram.com/LinearTransformation.html) + {1 , x , x^2 , x^3 .... , x^n } can form a base, for instance: If you decide that the base of the linear transformation should be``` {1, x , x^2} ```the vector``` [1 2 0]^T``` will represents the polynomial ```1 + 2x``` . + The matrix that represents integration in the base above is: | 0 0 0 | if you multiply this matrix for the vector above the result will be | 1 0 0 | [0 1 1]^T, x + x^2, the primitive of 1 + 2x | 0 1/2 0 |
